content:
Essentially the headline.

Called several people today, had some good talks some hang ups... but recently a lot of my calls have gone 'unheard'. Even had someone say "I'm on a national do not call list" but I couldn't even be heard!
Hi Thomas! Are you using one or two devices? Sometimes using two can be a little more consistent with audio
Was using one device. How would you recommend using two? I was using my phone to call and stay connected.
Do you have a laptop or tablet in addition to your phone? You can connect to the dialer on the larger device and then use your phone for audio.

When you first join the dialer, it will ask if you want to "Call with this device" or "Call with this device + phone for audio". If you pick the second, it will walk you through connecting your phone to the dialer ðŸ™‚
Unfortunately, not all on the same network. I have a desktop that is wired, and my phone is on the network.
my gf has a laptop... we were planning on phone banking together tomorrow.

I don't think it has to be on the same network - I think it calls your phone and uses that for audio but not your phone number. But check in tomorrow - there are lots of Mods with more expertiese than me on this one ðŸ™‚

Thomas, I always use two devices and I can assure you don't need to share the network. You could call from a land line, it wouldn't matter so long as your using scale to win on the computer. Sometimes I also have issues where they can't hear me. Sometimes they are faking it and the reason I know that is because I learned some tricks. If it happens more than 3x in a row, just disconnect your phone (hang up) and restart the session.
